data.text: What a difference a week makes. Last Wednesday, as the world economy slipped towards oblivion, British Prime Minister Gordon Brown emerged at the eleventh hour with a plan to get us all back on track. Under pressure and dismissed as one of the worst leaders this country has ever seen, Brown nevertheless stepped up to the challenge. His rescue plan for UK banks, unveiled last week, provided the template for the eurozone and US governments’ plans this week. And his medicine seems to be working, if the resurgent US and European stock markets are any indication.
